text.p: CryoLife Inc said Thursday it has acquired United Cryopreservation Foundation Inc, a processor and distributor of cryopreserved human heart valves and saphenous vein for transplant.
The transaction is valued at about $2.5 million, said Edwin Cordell, vice president and chief financial officer at CryoLife Inc.
Under the deal, CryoLife will pay about $2 million over five years and will assume about $500,000 in United Cryopreservation Foundation's obligations.
In exchange, CryoLife acquires the foundation's assets, including cryopreservation equipment and facilities. The not-for-profit foundation was organized in June 1992 as a tissue-processing facility.
CryoLife was founded in 1984. It develops and provides technology for ultra-low temperature preservation of viable human cardiovascular and orthopaedic tissues for use in surgery.
